<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// An option to enable unsafe alias results from the GlobalsModRef analysis.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When enabled, GlobalsModRef will provide no-alias results which in extremely</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// rare cases may not be conservatively correct. In particular, in the face of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// transforms which cause asymmetry between how effective getUnderlyingObject</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is for two pointers, it may produce incorrect results.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// These unsafe results have been returned by GMR for many years without</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// causing significant issues in the wild and so we provide a mechanism to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// re-enable them for users of LLVM that have a particular performance</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// sensitivity and no known issues. The option also makes it easy to evaluate</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the performance impact of these results.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54" lineLink="#a0782a22109da6d2417d0f8938a8aab5c"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cl/opt">cl::opt&lt;bool&gt;</a> <a href="#a0782a22109da6d2417d0f8938a8aab5c">EnableUnsafeGlobalsModRefAliasResults</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;enable-unsafe-globalsmodref-alias-results&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/cl/#ac12e6a8f3a1b511f0dee2ed6de0ae806">cl::init</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">), <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/cl/#a68075925a54790e71ca790e1d4f21a40a263ac008d8d31f13ce460395fc4cf7e6">cl::Hidden</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The mod/ref information collected for a particular function.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">/// We collect information about mod/ref behavior of a function here, both in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">/// general and as pertains to specific globals. We only have this detailed</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">/// information when we know &#42;something&#42; useful about the behavior. If we</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">/// saturate to fully general mod/ref, we remove the info for the function.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/globalsaaresult/functioninfo"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/globalsaaresult/functioninfo">GlobalsAAResult::FunctionInfo</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typedef</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smalldensemap">SmallDenseMap&lt;const GlobalValue &#42;, ModRefInfo, 16&gt;</a> GlobalInfoMapType;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Build a wrapper struct that has 8-byte alignment. All heap allocations</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// should provide this much alignment at least, but this makes it clear we</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// specifically rely on this amount of alignment.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">alignas</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(8) AlignedMap &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="normal">    GlobalInfoMapType Map;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;assert</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">alignof</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(AlignedMap) &gt;= (1 &lt;&lt; NumLowBitsAvailable),</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The bit that flags that this function may read any global. This is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// chosen to mix together with ModRefInfo bits.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FIXME: This assumes ModRefInfo lattice will remain 4 bits!</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FunctionInfo.getModRefInfo() masks out everything except ModRef so</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// this remains correct.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123; MayReadAnyGlobal = 4 &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Checks to document the invariants of the bit packing here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;assert</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">((MayReadAnyGlobal &amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9db8c44b250b90e3ab7e4d144e7c9c2ea6524b183b5cd0850f2cff6d30d581af9">ModRefInfo::ModRef</a>)) == 0,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="normal">                </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;ModRef and the MayReadAnyGlobal flag bits overlap.&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;assert</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(((MayReadAnyGlobal | </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9db8c44b250b90e3ab7e4d144e7c9c2ea6524b183b5cd0850f2cff6d30d581af9">ModRefInfo::ModRef</a>)) &gt;&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="normal">                 AlignedMapPointerTraits::NumLowBitsAvailable) == 0,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="normal">                </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Insufficient low bits to store our flag and ModRef info.&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// All of the information is encoded into a single pointer, with a three bit</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// integer in the low three bits. The high bit provides a flag for when this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// function may read any global. The low two bits are the ModRefInfo. And</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the pointer, when non-null, points to a map from GlobalValue to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// ModRefInfo specific to that GlobalValue.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointerintpair">PointerIntPair&lt;AlignedMap &#42;, 3, unsigned, AlignedMapPointerTraits&gt;</a> Info;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><Highlight kind="comment">/// AnalyzeGlobals - Scan through the users of all of the internal</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="comment">/// GlobalValue&#39;s in the program.  If none of them have their &quot;address taken&quot;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><Highlight kind="comment">/// (really, their address passed to something nontrivial), record this fact,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="365"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// some simple checks that we can do for functions that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="367"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a> = <a href="/docs/api/groups/arcopt/#ga9c9cf6ad55eb23d77d083a184e416c09">Call</a>-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#a2b1ae7cf1bafdd43d1fee4c6ad0a2913">getCalledFunction</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="373"><Highlight kind="normal">            </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="374"><Highlight kind="normal">          </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that the NoCallback check here is a little bit too</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><Highlight kind="comment">/// AnalyzeIndirectGlobalMemory - We found an non-address-taken global variable</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><Highlight kind="comment">/// which holds a pointer type.  See if the global always points to non-aliased</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><Highlight kind="comment">/// heap memory: that is, all initializers of the globals store a value known</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to be obtained via a noalias return function call which have no other use.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Further, all loads out of GV must directly use the memory, not store the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><Highlight kind="comment">/// pointer somewhere.  If this is true, we consider the memory pointed to by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="412"><Highlight kind="comment">/// GV to be owned by GV and can disambiguate other pointers from it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="413"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> GlobalsAAResult::AnalyzeIndirectGlobalMemory(GlobalVariable &#42;GV) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="414"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Keep track of values related to the allocation of the memory, f.e. the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="415"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// value produced by the noalias call and any casts.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="416"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::vector&lt;Value &#42;&gt; AllocRelatedValues;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="417"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="418"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the initializer is a valid pointer, bail.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="419"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Constant &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a> = GV-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvariable/#a0698d5bcabbfbca4f56a9d7a81cecb25">getInitializer</a>())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="420"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a>-&gt;isNullValue())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="421"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="422"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="423"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Walk the user list of the global.  If we find anything other than a direct</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="424"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// load or store, bail out.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="425"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (User &#42;U : GV-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#a411cf3e3932f209ce3374cb31adc1da6">users</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (LoadInst &#42;LI = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;LoadInst&gt;</a>(U)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The pointer loaded from the global can only be used in simple ways:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// we allow addressing of it and loading storing to it.  We do &#42;not&#42; allow</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// storing the loaded pointer somewhere else or passing to a function.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="430"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (AnalyzeUsesOfPointer(LI))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="431"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Loaded pointer escapes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: Could try some IP mod/ref of the loaded pointer.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (StoreInst &#42;SI = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;StoreInst&gt;</a>(U)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Storing the global itself.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="435"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/siencodingfamily/#ac0e8470f1a7e777b89ff85c06a5d46e0a53036b329d60f608f01b3fa1b8f0a473">SI</a>-&gt;getOperand(0) == GV)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="436"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ca992e52dddc420f4b069cae06dfbe">isa&lt;ConstantPointerNull&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/siencodingfamily/#ac0e8470f1a7e777b89ff85c06a5d46e0a53036b329d60f608f01b3fa1b8f0a473">SI</a>-&gt;getOperand(0)))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="440"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="442"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check the value being stored.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="447"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00448" /><CodeLine lineNumber="448"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Analyze all uses of the allocation.  If any of them are used in a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="455"><Highlight kind="normal">      AllocRelatedValues.push&#95;back(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/targetlibraryinfo-cpp/#aca185e6d0e9f423dbb24440206454872a11dbf501abf829b3ab7049c2d3a8a053">Ptr</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="458"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="459"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="462"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Okay, this is an indirect global.  Remember all of the allocations for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="463"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// this global in AllocsForIndirectGlobals.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="464"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">while</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!AllocRelatedValues.empty()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00465" /><CodeLine lineNumber="465"><Highlight kind="normal">    AllocsForIndirectGlobals&#91;AllocRelatedValues.back()&#93; = GV;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00466" /><CodeLine lineNumber="466"><Highlight kind="normal">    Handles.emplace&#95;front(&#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, AllocRelatedValues.back());</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00685" /><CodeLine lineNumber="685"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00686" /><CodeLine lineNumber="686"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// All inputs were known to be no-alias.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00687" /><CodeLine lineNumber="687"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00688" /><CodeLine lineNumber="688"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00689" /><CodeLine lineNumber="689"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00690" /><CodeLine lineNumber="690"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// There are particular cases where we can conclude no-alias between</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00691" /><CodeLine lineNumber="691"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a non-addr-taken global and some other underlying object. Specifically,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00692" /><CodeLine lineNumber="692"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a non-addr-taken global is known to not be escaped from any function. It is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00693" /><CodeLine lineNumber="693"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// also incorrect for a transformation to introduce an escape of a global in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00694" /><CodeLine lineNumber="694"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a way that is observable when it was not there previously. One function</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00695" /><CodeLine lineNumber="695"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// being transformed to introduce an escape which could possibly be observed</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00696" /><CodeLine lineNumber="696"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (via loading from a global or the return value for example) within another</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00697" /><CodeLine lineNumber="697"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// function is never safe. If the observation is made through non-atomic</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00698" /><CodeLine lineNumber="698"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// operations on different threads, it is a data-race and UB. If the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00699" /><CodeLine lineNumber="699"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// observation is well defined, by being observed the transformation would have</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00700" /><CodeLine lineNumber="700"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// changed program behavior by introducing the observed escape, making it an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00701" /><CodeLine lineNumber="701"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// invalid transform.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00702" /><CodeLine lineNumber="702"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00703" /><CodeLine lineNumber="703"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This property does require that transformations which &#42;temporarily&#42; escape</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00704" /><CodeLine lineNumber="704"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a global that was not previously escaped, prior to restoring it, cannot rely</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00705" /><CodeLine lineNumber="705"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// on the results of GMR::alias. This seems a reasonable restriction, although</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00706" /><CodeLine lineNumber="706"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// currently there is no way to enforce it. There is also no realistic</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00707" /><CodeLine lineNumber="707"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// optimization pass that would make this mistake. The closest example is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00708" /><CodeLine lineNumber="708"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a transformation pass which does reg2mem of SSA values but stores them into</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00709" /><CodeLine lineNumber="709"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// global variables temporarily before restoring the global variable&#39;s value.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="710"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This could be useful to expose &quot;benign&quot; races for example. However, it seems</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="711"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// reasonable to require that a pass which introduces escapes of global</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="712"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// variables in this way to either not trust AA results while the escape is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="713"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// active, or to be forced to operate as a module pass that cannot co-exist</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="714"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with an alias analysis such as GMR.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="715"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> GlobalsAAResult::isNonEscapingGlobalNoAlias(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> GlobalValue &#42;GV,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="716"><Highlight kind="normal">                                                 </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a> &#42;V) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="717"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In order to know that the underlying object cannot alias the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00718" /><CodeLine lineNumber="718"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// non-addr-taken global, we must know that it would have to be an escape.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00719" /><CodeLine lineNumber="719"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Thus if the underlying object is a function argument, a load from</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00720" /><CodeLine lineNumber="720"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a global, or the return of a function, it cannot alias. We can also</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00721" /><CodeLine lineNumber="721"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// recurse through PHI nodes and select nodes provided all of their inputs</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00722" /><CodeLine lineNumber="722"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// resolve to one of these known-escaping roots.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00723" /><CodeLine lineNumber="723"><Highlight kind="normal">  SmallPtrSet&lt;const Value &#42;, 8&gt; Visited;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00724" /><CodeLine lineNumber="724"><Highlight kind="normal">  SmallVector&lt;const Value &#42;, 8&gt; Inputs;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00725" /><CodeLine lineNumber="725"><Highlight kind="normal">  Visited.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrsetimpl/#a9d834ae3da8c62c2b668dada51335eb0">insert</a>(V);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00726" /><CodeLine lineNumber="726"><Highlight kind="normal">  Inputs.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatebase/#af42bfbc067df27c19ee2fc859df58799">push&#95;back</a>(V);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00727" /><CodeLine lineNumber="727"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1eb5609345b906d024fbf9e4bc1adc06afe578efb7ca235af77fb0eef7edcf639">Depth</a> = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00728" /><CodeLine lineNumber="728"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">do</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00729" /><CodeLine lineNumber="729"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a> &#42;Input = Inputs.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl/#a0c8ffe664a36e30d49c84d0aded2fe08">pop&#95;back&#95;val</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00733" /><CodeLine lineNumber="733"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// conclude no-alias.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00734" /><CodeLine lineNumber="734"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (InputGV == GV)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00792" /><CodeLine lineNumber="792"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a> : PN-&gt;incoming&#95;values()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalsaaresult/#a6a669878583bed7b1ce9d1328b6b247e"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalsaaresult/#a6a669878583bed7b1ce9d1328b6b247e">GlobalsAAResult::invalidate</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/module">Module</a> &amp;, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/preservedanalyses">PreservedAnalyses</a> &amp;PA,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="814"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> PAC = PA.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/preservedanalyses/#aa7a1b769f9c57010cc41d9c3bb9d39c6">getChecker</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalsaa">GlobalsAA</a>&gt;();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><Highlight kind="comment">/// alias - If one of the pointers is to a global that we are tracking, and the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><Highlight kind="comment">/// other is some random pointer, we know there cannot be an alias, because the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><Highlight kind="comment">/// address of the global isn&#39;t taken.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalsaaresult/#ad1af2012f83ff1c94df346bbc8ac3b6a"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aliasresult">AliasResult</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalsaaresult/#ad1af2012f83ff1c94df346bbc8ac3b6a">GlobalsAAResult::alias</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation">MemoryLocation</a> &amp;LocA,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><Highlight kind="normal">                                   </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation">MemoryLocation</a> &amp;LocB,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><Highlight kind="normal">                                   <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aaqueryinfo">AAQueryInfo</a> &amp;AAQI, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Get the base object these pointers point to.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;UV1 =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="826"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3b1c5788b85ffa254be0e834edf5cf8f">getUnderlyingObject</a>(LocA.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation/#a9550ce4a179e46db37f653ce28feca7a">Ptr</a>-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#af7ce93500c8d9a8fbd0a40e461f3b780">stripPointerCastsForAliasAnalysis</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;UV2 =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="828"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3b1c5788b85ffa254be0e834edf5cf8f">getUnderlyingObject</a>(LocB.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation/#a9550ce4a179e46db37f653ce28feca7a">Ptr</a>-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#af7ce93500c8d9a8fbd0a40e461f3b780">stripPointerCastsForAliasAnalysis</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="829"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="830"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If either of the underlying values is a global, they may be non-addr-taken</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00831" /><CodeLine lineNumber="831"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// globals, which we can answer queries about.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="832"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue">GlobalValue</a> &#42;GV1 = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;GlobalValue&gt;</a>(UV1);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="833"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue">GlobalValue</a> &#42;GV2 = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;GlobalValue&gt;</a>(UV2);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="834"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (GV1 || GV2) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="835"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the global&#39;s address is taken, pretend we don&#39;t know it&#39;s a pointer to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="836"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the global.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="837"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (GV1 &amp;&amp; !NonAddressTakenGlobals.count(GV1))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="838"><Highlight kind="normal">      GV1 = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="839"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (GV2 &amp;&amp; !NonAddressTakenGlobals.count(GV2))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="840"><Highlight kind="normal">      GV2 = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00841" /><CodeLine lineNumber="841"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="842"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the two pointers are derived from two different non-addr-taken</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00843" /><CodeLine lineNumber="843"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// globals we know these can&#39;t alias.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00844" /><CodeLine lineNumber="844"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (GV1 &amp;&amp; GV2 &amp;&amp; GV1 != GV2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00845" /><CodeLine lineNumber="845"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aliasresult/#a8d3de277fb70fa515efac2db2cfe9d57a863ee317b92588eb2d6878af9fc98922">AliasResult::NoAlias</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00846" /><CodeLine lineNumber="846"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00847" /><CodeLine lineNumber="847"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If one is and the other isn&#39;t, it isn&#39;t strictly safe but we can fake</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00848" /><CodeLine lineNumber="848"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// this result if necessary for performance. This does not appear to be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00849" /><CodeLine lineNumber="849"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a common problem in practice.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00850" /><CodeLine lineNumber="850"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="#a0782a22109da6d2417d0f8938a8aab5c">EnableUnsafeGlobalsModRefAliasResults</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="851"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ((GV1 || GV2) &amp;&amp; GV1 != GV2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00852" /><CodeLine lineNumber="852"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aliasresult/#a8d3de277fb70fa515efac2db2cfe9d57a863ee317b92588eb2d6878af9fc98922">AliasResult::NoAlias</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00853" /><CodeLine lineNumber="853"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00854" /><CodeLine lineNumber="854"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check for a special case where a non-escaping global can be used to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00855" /><CodeLine lineNumber="855"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// conclude no-alias.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00856" /><CodeLine lineNumber="856"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ((GV1 || GV2) &amp;&amp; GV1 != GV2) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="857"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue">GlobalValue</a> &#42;GV = GV1 ? GV1 : GV2;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00858" /><CodeLine lineNumber="858"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;UV = GV1 ? UV2 : UV1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00859" /><CodeLine lineNumber="859"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (isNonEscapingGlobalNoAlias(GV, UV))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00860" /><CodeLine lineNumber="860"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aliasresult/#a8d3de277fb70fa515efac2db2cfe9d57a863ee317b92588eb2d6878af9fc98922">AliasResult::NoAlias</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00861" /><CodeLine lineNumber="861"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00862" /><CodeLine lineNumber="862"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00863" /><CodeLine lineNumber="863"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Otherwise if they are both derived from the same addr-taken global, we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00864" /><CodeLine lineNumber="864"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// can&#39;t know the two accesses don&#39;t overlap.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00865" /><CodeLine lineNumber="865"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00866" /><CodeLine lineNumber="866"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00867" /><CodeLine lineNumber="867"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// These pointers may be based on the memory owned by an indirect global.  If</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00868" /><CodeLine lineNumber="868"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// so, we may be able to handle this.  First check to see if the base pointer</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00869" /><CodeLine lineNumber="869"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is a direct load from an indirect global.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00870" /><CodeLine lineNumber="870"><Highlight kind="normal">  GV1 = GV2 = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00871" /><CodeLine lineNumber="871"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loadinst">LoadInst</a> &#42;LI = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;LoadInst&gt;</a>(UV1))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00872" /><CodeLine lineNumber="872"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvariable">GlobalVariable</a> &#42;GV = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;GlobalVariable&gt;</a>(LI-&gt;getOperand(0)))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00873" /><CodeLine lineNumber="873"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (IndirectGlobals.count(GV))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00874" /><CodeLine lineNumber="874"><Highlight kind="normal">        GV1 = GV;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00875" /><CodeLine lineNumber="875"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loadinst">LoadInst</a> &#42;LI = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;LoadInst&gt;</a>(UV2))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00876" /><CodeLine lineNumber="876"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvariable">GlobalVariable</a> &#42;GV = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;GlobalVariable&gt;</a>(LI-&gt;getOperand(0)))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00877" /><CodeLine lineNumber="877"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (IndirectGlobals.count(GV))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00878" /><CodeLine lineNumber="878"><Highlight kind="normal">        GV2 = GV;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00879" /><CodeLine lineNumber="879"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00880" /><CodeLine lineNumber="880"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// These pointers may also be from an allocation for the indirect global.  If</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00881" /><CodeLine lineNumber="881"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// so, also handle them.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00882" /><CodeLine lineNumber="882"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!GV1)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00883" /><CodeLine lineNumber="883"><Highlight kind="normal">    GV1 = AllocsForIndirectGlobals.lookup(UV1);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00884" /><CodeLine lineNumber="884"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!GV2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00885" /><CodeLine lineNumber="885"><Highlight kind="normal">    GV2 = AllocsForIndirectGlobals.lookup(UV2);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00886" /><CodeLine lineNumber="886"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00887" /><CodeLine lineNumber="887"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Now that we know whether the two pointers are related to indirect globals,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00888" /><CodeLine lineNumber="888"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// use this to disambiguate the pointers. If the pointers are based on</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00889" /><CodeLine lineNumber="889"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// different indirect globals they cannot alias.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00890" /><CodeLine lineNumber="890"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (GV1 &amp;&amp; GV2 &amp;&amp; GV1 != GV2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00891" /><CodeLine lineNumber="891"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aliasresult/#a8d3de277fb70fa515efac2db2cfe9d57a863ee317b92588eb2d6878af9fc98922">AliasResult::NoAlias</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00892" /><CodeLine lineNumber="892"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00893" /><CodeLine lineNumber="893"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If one is based on an indirect global and the other isn&#39;t, it isn&#39;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00894" /><CodeLine lineNumber="894"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// strictly safe but we can fake this result if necessary for performance.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00895" /><CodeLine lineNumber="895"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This does not appear to be a common problem in practice.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00896" /><CodeLine lineNumber="896"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="#a0782a22109da6d2417d0f8938a8aab5c">EnableUnsafeGlobalsModRefAliasResults</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00897" /><CodeLine lineNumber="897"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ((GV1 || GV2) &amp;&amp; GV1 != GV2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00898" /><CodeLine lineNumber="898"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aliasresult/#a8d3de277fb70fa515efac2db2cfe9d57a863ee317b92588eb2d6878af9fc98922">AliasResult::NoAlias</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00899" /><CodeLine lineNumber="899"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00900" /><CodeLine lineNumber="900"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/aliasresult/#a8d3de277fb70fa515efac2db2cfe9d57a0916b614598c673c1e6a59c7312a1409">AliasResult::MayAlias</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00901" /><CodeLine lineNumber="901"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00902" /><CodeLine lineNumber="902"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00903" /><CodeLine lineNumber="903"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9db8c44b250b90e3ab7e4d144e7c9c2e">ModRefInfo</a> GlobalsAAResult::getModRefInfoForArgument(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/groups/arcopt/#ga9c9cf6ad55eb23d77d083a184e416c09">Call</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
